page.title: 10 HOUSING
page.content: There are plenty of picturesque,typical Devon thatch & cob cottages in East Budleigh,especially along the little altered High Street & beside Budleigh Brook.Few are dated but many are over 150 yrs old.Farm buildings occupy much of the village outskirts.A significant amount of new housing,in estates,has accompanied the population increase since 1971.Unusually,this has been in the village centre rather than on the edge.Hayes Barton is an Elizabethan Farmhouse famous for its association with Raleigh.Bicton House is prominent for its size,period & gardens.An interesting change since 1978 has been the conversion of the old railway station at Otterton into a house with the platform as a patio,-on sale for 79000 pounds.Houses in the area may be considered by people looking for holi- day homes. By J.Ross & A.Kain
